awd_titl_txt: Integrating High Performance Liquid Chromatography into     Undergraduate Chemistry Education
awd_abstract_narration: The project will acquaint undergraduate chemistry students at Muhlenberg        College with high performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) and its uses         and limitations in chemical analysis.  Several HPLC instruments will be         available so that small groups of students can work on chemical                 separation problems without interruption.  The problems assigned will be        selected from the areas of clinical, forensic, and environmental                chemistry:  for example, the determination of phenol in wastewater,             metabolites in blood, and components in over-the-counter drugs.  This           will give the students a balanced view of the importance of modern              chromatography in the analytical laboratory, and better prepare them for        graduate study or industrial work. Students will design and discuss             experimental plans for their laboratory work, providing a foundation for        future experimental design and work in the laboratories.
